blocks.content: Express the predicate " ` M ` is a measure." Definition 112A of [Fremlin1] p. 14. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)

blocks.name: dmmeasal
blocks.content: The domain of a measure is a sigma-algebra. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)

blocks.name: meaf
blocks.content: A measure is a function that maps to nonnegative extended reals. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: mea0

blocks.name: nnfoctbdj
blocks.content: There exists a mapping from ` NN ` onto any (nonempty) countable set of disjoint sets, such that elements in the range of the map are disjoint. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: meadjuni
blocks.content: The measure of the disjoint union of a countable set is the extended sum of the measures. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm meadjuni(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(c1)), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, c1))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cmea))
  -| wceq(c2, cdm(c0))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, cdom, com))
  -| wi(w0, wdisj(s0, c1, cv(s0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpd(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(c1)), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, c1))), wa(wbr(c1, cdom, com), wdisj(s0, c1, cv(s0))))
  jca(w0, wbr(c1, cdom, com), wdisj(s0, c1, cv(s0)))
  syl2anc(w0, wi(wa(wbr(c1, cdom, com), wdisj(s0, c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(c1)), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, c1)))), wcel(c1, cpw(cdm(c0))), wral(hs0, cpw(cdm(c0)), wi(wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cdom, com), wdisj(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(cv(hs0))), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, cv(hs0)))))))
  mpbird(w0, wcel(c1, cpw(cdm(c0))), wss(c1, cdm(c0)))
  syl6sseq(c1, cdm(c0), c2, w0)
  syl(w0, wb(wcel(c1, cpw(cdm(c0))), wss(c1, cdm(c0))), wcel(c1, universe))
  ssexd(c1, c2, csalg, w0)
  dmmeasal(c2, c0, w0)
  elpwg(c1, universe, cdm(c0))
  simprd(w0, wral(hs0, cpw(cdm(c0)), wi(wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cdom, com), wdisj(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(cv(hs0))), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, cv(hs0)))))), wa(wa(wf(c0, cdm(c0), co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)), wcel(cdm(c0), csalg)), wceq(cfv(c0, emptycls), nat0)))
  sylib(w0, wa(wa(wa(wf(c0, cdm(c0), co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)), wcel(cdm(c0), csalg)), wceq(cfv(c0, emptycls), nat0)), wral(hs0, cpw(cdm(c0)), wi(wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cdom, com), wdisj(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(cv(hs0))), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, cv(hs0))))))), wcel(c0, cmea))
  ismea(hs0, s0, c0)
  rspcva(hs0, c1, cpw(cdm(c0)), wi(wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cdom, com), wdisj(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(cv(hs0))), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, cv(hs0))))), wi(wa(wbr(c1, cdom, com), wdisj(s0, c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(c1)), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, c1)))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cdom, com), wdisj(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(cv(hs0))), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, cv(hs0)))), wa(wbr(c1, cdom, com), wdisj(s0, c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(c1)), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, c1))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wbr(cv(hs0), cdom, com), wdisj(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wbr(c1, cdom, com), wdisj(s0, c1, cv(s0)))
  breq1(cv(hs0), c1, cdom, com)
  disjeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c1, cv(s0))
  eqeq12d(cfv(c0, cuni(cv(hs0))), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c0, cuni(c1)), cfv(csumge0, cres(c0, c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  fveq2d(c0, cuni(cv(hs0)), cuni(c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c1)
  fveq2d(csumge0, cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cres(c0, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  reseq2(cv(hs0), c1, c0)

  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)

thm meadjuni(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` ‚ãÉ c1)=(sum^ `(c0 |` c1)))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà Meas)
  ‚ä£ c2 = dom(c0)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚äÜ c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1[‚âº]_om)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí ‚äî(s0 ‚àà c1, s0))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpd(w0, (c0 ` ‚ãÉ c1)=(sum^ `(c0 |` c1)), (c1[‚âº]_om ‚àß ‚äî(s0 ‚àà c1, s0)))
  jca(w0, c1[‚âº]_om, ‚äî(s0 ‚àà c1, s0))
  syl2anc(w0, ((c1[‚âº]_om ‚àß ‚äî(s0 ‚àà c1, s0))‚Üí(c0 ` ‚ãÉ c1)=(sum^ `(c0 |` c1))), c1 ‚àà P(dom(c0)), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà P(dom(c0)),((hs0[‚âº]_om ‚àß ‚äî(s0 ‚àà hs0, s0))‚Üí(c0 ` ‚ãÉ hs0)=(sum^ `(c0 |` hs0)))))
  mpbird(w0, c1 ‚àà P(dom(c0)), c1 ‚äÜ dom(c0))
  syl6sseq(c1, dom(c0), c2, w0)
  syl(w0, (c1 ‚àà P(dom(c0))‚Üî c1 ‚äÜ dom(c0)), c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  ssexd(c1, c2, csalg, w0)
  dmmeasal(c2, c0, w0)
  elpwg(c1, universe, dom(c0))
  simprd(w0, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà P(dom(c0)),((hs0[‚âº]_om ‚àß ‚äî(s0 ‚àà hs0, s0))‚Üí(c0 ` ‚ãÉ hs0)=(sum^ `(c0 |` hs0)))), (((c0 : dom(c0)‚Üí(0[[,]]+‚àû))‚àß dom(c0)‚àà SAlg)‚àß(c0 ` ‚àÖ)= 0))
  sylib(w0, ((((c0 : dom(c0)‚Üí(0[[,]]+‚àû))‚àß dom(c0)‚àà SAlg)‚àß(c0 ` ‚àÖ)= 0)‚àß ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà P(dom(c0)),((hs0[‚âº]_om ‚àß ‚äî(s0 ‚àà hs0, s0))‚Üí(c0 ` ‚ãÉ hs0)=(sum^ `(c0 |` hs0))))), c0 ‚àà Meas)
  ismea(hs0, s0, c0)
  rspcva(hs0, c1, P(dom(c0)), ((hs0[‚âº]_om ‚àß ‚äî(s0 ‚àà hs0, s0))‚Üí(c0 ` ‚ãÉ hs0)=(sum^ `(c0 |` hs0))), ((c1[‚âº]_om ‚àß ‚äî(s0 ‚àà c1, s0))‚Üí(c0 ` ‚ãÉ c1)=(sum^ `(c0 |` c1))))
  imbi12d(hs0 = c1, (hs0[‚âº]_om ‚àß ‚äî(s0 ‚àà hs0, s0)), (c0 ` ‚ãÉ hs0)=(sum^ `(c0 |` hs0)), (c1[‚âº]_om ‚àß ‚äî(s0 ‚àà c1, s0)), (c0 ` ‚ãÉ c1)=(sum^ `(c0 |` c1)))
  anbi12d(hs0 = c1, hs0[‚âº]_om, ‚äî(s0 ‚àà hs0, s0), c1[‚âº]_om, ‚äî(s0 ‚àà c1, s0))
  breq1(hs0, c1, cdom, com)
  disjeq1(s0, hs0, c1, s0)
  eqeq12d((c0 ` ‚ãÉ hs0), (sum^ `(c0 |` hs0)), (c0 ` ‚ãÉ c1), (sum^ `(c0 |` c1)), hs0 = c1)

blocks.name: meacl

blocks.name: iundjiunlem
blocks.content: The sets in the sequence ` F ` are disjoint. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)

thm iundjiunlem(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cin(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2)), emptycls))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c3, cdif(cfv(c5, cv(s0)), ciun(s1, co(c4, cfzo, cv(s0)), cfv(c5, cv(s1))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, clt, c2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
} = {
  eqtrd(cin(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2)), emptycls, cin(cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, c1)), w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(cin(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2)), cin(cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, c1))))
  incom(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2))
  sylibr(w0, wceq(cin(cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, c1)), emptycls), wral(hs0, cfv(c0, c2), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, c1)))))
  ralrimiva(hs0, cfv(c0, c2), w0, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, c1))))
  neleqtrd(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, c1), cdif(cfv(c5, c1), ciun(s1, co(c4, cfzo, c1), cfv(c5, cv(s1)))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, c2))))

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí((c0 ` c1)‚ãÇ(c0 ` c2))= ‚àÖ)

  a1i(w0, ((c0 ` c1)‚ãÇ(c0 ` c2))=((c0 ` c2)‚ãÇ(c0 ` c1)))

  syl((w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà(c0 ` c2)), ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà((c5 ` c1)\ ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà(c4[..^]c1),(c5 ` s1))), ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà(c5 ` c1))

  simpr(w0, hs0 ‚àà(c0 ` c2))
  syl((w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà(c0 ` c2)), (c0 ` c2)=((c5 ` c2)\ ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà(c4[..^]c2),(c5 ` s1))), w0)
  simpl(w0, hs0 ‚àà(c0 ` c2))

  fveq2(s0, c2, c5)
  iuneq1d(s1, (c4[..^]s0), (c5 ` s1), (c4[..^]c2), s0 = c2)
  oveq2(s0, c2, c4, cfzo)

  eldifi(hs0, (c5 ` c1), ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà(c4[..^]c1),(c5 ` s1)))
  eqcomd(((c5 ` c1)\ ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà(c4[..^]c1),(c5 ` s1))), (c0 ` c1), (w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà(c0 ` c2)))
  adantr(w0, hs0 ‚àà(c0 ` c2), (c0 ` c1)=((c5 ` c1)\ ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà(c4[..^]c1),(c5 ` s1))))
  syl(w0, (c0 ` c1)=((c5 ` c1)\ ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà(c4[..^]c1),(c5 ` s1))), c1 ‚àà c3)
  fvmpt(s0, c1, c3, c0, ((c5 ` c1)\ ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà(c4[..^]c1),(c5 ` s1))), ((c5 ` s0)\ ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà(c4[..^]s0),(c5 ` s1))))
  difeq12d((c5 ` s0), ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà(c4[..^]s0),(c5 ` s1)), (c5 ` c1), ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà(c4[..^]c1),(c5 ` s1)), s0 = c1)
  fveq2(s0, c1, c5)

blocks.name: iundjiun
blocks.content: Given a sequence ` E ` of sets, a sequence ` F ` of disjoint sets is built, such that the indexed union stays the same. As in the proof of Property 112C (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 16. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)

blocks.name: meaxrcl
blocks.content: The measure of a set is an extended real. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)

blocks.name: meadjun
blocks.content: The measure of the union of two disjoint sets is the sum of the measures, Property 112C (a) of [Fremlin1] p. 15. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)

blocks.name: meassle
blocks.content: The measure of a set is greater than or equal to the measure of a subset, Property 112C (b) of [Fremlin1] p. 15. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm meassle(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(cfv(c0, c1), cle, cfv(c0, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cmea))
  -| wceq(c3, cdm(c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, c2))
} = {
  breqtrd(cfv(c0, c1), cle, cfv(c0, c2), co(cfv(c0, c1), cxad, cfv(c0, cdif(c2, c1))), w0)
  xadd0ge(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, cdif(c2, c1)), w0)
  meaxrcl(c0, c1, c3, w0)
  meacl(c0, cdif(c2, c1), c3, w0)
  eqtr2d(co(cfv(c0, c1), cxad, cfv(c0, cdif(c2, c1))), cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, cun(c1, cdif(c2, c1))), w0)
  eqcomd(cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, cun(c1, cdif(c2, c1))), w0)
  fveq2d(c0, cun(c1, cdif(c2, c1)), c2, w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(cun(c1, cdif(c2, c1)), c2), wss(c1, c2))
  biimpi(wss(c1, c2), wceq(cun(c1, cdif(c2, c1)), c2))
  undif(c1, c2)
  meadjun(c0, c1, cdif(c2, c1), c3, w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wcel(cdif(c2, c1), c3), wcel(c3, csalg), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c1, c3))
  dmmeasal(c3, c0, w0)
  saldifcl2(c3, c2, c1)
  a1i(w0, wceq(cin(c1, cdif(c2, c1)), emptycls))
  disjdif(c1, c2)
}

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)[‚â§](c0 ` c2))

blocks.name: meaunle
blocks.content: The measure of the union of two sets is less than or equal to the sum of the measures, Property 112C (c) of [Fremlin1] p. 15. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)

thm meaunle(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {

blocks.name: meadjiun
blocks.content: The measure of the disjoint union of a countable set is the extended sum of the measures. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: meaiunlelem
blocks.content: The measure of the union of countable sets is less than or equal to the sum of the measures, Property 112C (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 16. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)

blocks.name: meaiunle
blocks.content: The measure of the union of countable sets is less than or equal to the sum of the measures, Property 112C (d) of [Fremlin1] p. 16. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 17-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm meaiunle(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(cfv(c0, ciun(s0, c1, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), cle, cfv(csumge0, cmpt(s0, c1, cfv(c0, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cmea))
  -| wceq(c3, cdm(c0))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cuz, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c2, c1, c3))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  meaiunlelem(s0, hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, cmpt(s0, c1, cdif(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), ciun(hs0, co(c4, cfzo, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(hs0))))), w0)
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c1, cdif(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), ciun(hs0, co(c4, cfzo, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(hs0))))))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c1,(c2 ` s0)))[‚â§](sum^ `(s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶(c0 `(c2 ` s0)))))
  ‚ä£ F/(s0, w0)

  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)

  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)

blocks.name: volmea
blocks.content: The Lebeasgue measure on the Reals is actually a measure. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 3-Mar-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm volmea(wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cvol, cmea))
} = {

  vol0()
  syl3anc(w3a(w0, wf(cv(hs0), cn, cdm(cvol)), wdisj(hs1, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), wceq(cfv(cvol, ciun(hs1, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), cfv(csumge0, cmpt(hs1, cn, cfv(cvol, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))), w0, wf(cv(hs0), cn, cdm(cvol)), wdisj(hs2, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))
  simp1(w0, wf(cv(hs0), cn, cdm(cvol)), wdisj(hs1, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  simp2(w0, wf(cv(hs0), cn, cdm(cvol)), wdisj(hs1, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  3ad2ant3(w0, wf(cv(hs0), cn, cdm(cvol)), wdisj(hs1, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wdisj(hs2, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))
  biimpri(wdisj(hs1, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wdisj(hs2, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))
  voliunsge0(hs1, cv(hs0), w3a(w0, wf(cv(hs0), cn, cdm(cvol)), wdisj(hs2, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))))
  simp2(w0, wf(cv(hs0), cn, cdm(cvol)), wdisj(hs2, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))
  3ad2ant3(w0, wf(cv(hs0), cn, cdm(cvol)), wdisj(hs2, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))), wdisj(hs1, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  biimpi(wdisj(hs2, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))), wdisj(hs1, cn, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))

  diff.hs1.c(cvol)

blocks.name: meage0

  a1i(w0, wcel(nat0, cxr))

  a1i(w0, wcel(cpnf, cxr))

blocks.name: meadjunre
blocks.content: The measure of the union of two disjoint sets, with finite measure, is the sum of the measures, Property 112C (a) of [Fremlin1] p. 15. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm meadjunre(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, cun(c1, c2)), co(cfv(c0, c1), caddc, cfv(c0, c2))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cmea))
  -| wceq(c3, cdm(c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cin(c1, c2), emptycls))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c2), cr))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(c0, cun(c1, c2)), co(cfv(c0, c1), caddc, cfv(c0, c2)), co(cfv(c0, c1), cxad, cfv(c0, c2)), w0)
  meadjun(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  rexaddd(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2), w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm meadjunre(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 `(c1 ‚ãÉ c2))=((c0 ` c1)[+](c0 ` c2)))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà Meas)

  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c2)‚àà ‚Ñù)
} = {
  eqtrd((c0 `(c1 ‚ãÉ c2)), ((c0 ` c1)[+](c0 ` c2)), ((c0 ` c1)[+](c0 ` c2)), w0)

}

blocks.name: meassre
blocks.content: If the measure of a measurable set is real, then the measure of any of its measurable subsets is real. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)

  |- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), cr))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cdm(c0)))
} = {
  sseldi(cfv(c0, c1), cr, co(nat0, cico, cpnf), w0)
  rge0ssre()
  elicod(cfv(c0, c1), nat0, cpnf, w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(nat0, cxr))
  0xr()
  meage0(c0, c1, w0)
  xrlelttrd(cfv(c0, c1), cpnf, cfv(c0, c2), w0)
  meaxrcl(c0, c1, cdm(c0), w0)
  rexrd(cfv(c0, c2), w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(cpnf, cxr))
  pnfxr()

  eqid(cdm(c0))
  ltpnfd(cfv(c0, c2), w0)
}

thm meadif(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 `(c1 \ c2))=((c0 ` c1)[-](c0 ` c2)))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà Meas)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà dom(c0))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)‚àà ‚Ñù)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà dom(c0))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚äÜ c1)
} = {
  mpbid(w0, (c0 `(c1 \ c2))=((c0 ` c1)[-](c0 ` c2)), ((c0 ` c2)[+](c0 `(c1 \ c2)))=(c0 ` c1))
  eqtr2d(((c0 ` c2)[+](c0 `(c1 \ c2))), (c0 ` c1), (c0 `(c2 ‚ãÉ(c1 \ c2))), w0)
  fveq2d(c0, c1, (c2 ‚ãÉ(c1 \ c2)), w0)
  eqcomd(c1, (c2 ‚ãÉ(c1 \ c2)), w0)
  sylib(w0, (c2 ‚ãÉ(c1 \ c2))= c1, c2 ‚äÜ c1)
  undif(c2, c1)
  meadjunre(c0, c2, (c1 \ c2), dom(c0), w0)
  a1i(w0, (c2 ‚ãÇ(c1 \ c2))= ‚àÖ)
  disjdif(c2, c1)
  addrsub((c0 ` c2), (c0 `(c1 \ c2)), (c0 ` c1), w0)
  recnd((c0 ` c2), w0)
  meassre(c0, c2, c1, w0)
  recnd((c0 `(c1 \ c2)), w0)
  meassre(c0, (c1 \ c2), c1, w0)
  difssd(c1, c2, w0)
  syl3anc(w0, (c1 \ c2)‚àà dom(c0), dom(c0)‚àà SAlg, c1 ‚àà dom(c0), c2 ‚àà dom(c0))
  dmmeasal(dom(c0), c0, w0)
  eqid(dom(c0))
  saldifcl2(dom(c0), c1, c2)
  recnd((c0 ` c1), w0)
}

blocks.name: meaiuninclem
blocks.content: Measures are continuous from below (bounded case): if ` E ` is a sequence of increasing measurable sets (with uniformly bounded measure) then the measure of the union is the union of the measure. This is Proposition 112C (e) of [Fremlin1] p. 16. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: meaiuninc
blocks.content: Measures are continuous from below (bounded case): if ` E ` is a sequence of nondecreasing measurable sets (with bounded measure) then the measure of the union is the limit of the measures. This is Proposition 112C (e) of [Fremlin1] p. 16. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm meaiuninc(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cli, cfv(c1, ciun(s0, c2, cfv(c3, cv(s0))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cmea))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cz))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c3, c2, cdm(c1)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wss(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s1, cr, wral(s0, c2, wbr(cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(s0))), cle, cv(s1)))))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c2, cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  eqbrtrd(c0, cli, cfv(c1, ciun(s0, c2, cfv(c3, cv(s0)))), cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)))), w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(c0, cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(hs0))))))
  meaiuninclem(s0, s1, hs1, cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)))), c1, c2, c3, c4, cmpt(hs0, c2, cdif(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), ciun(hs2, co(c4, cfzo, cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, cv(hs2))))), w0)
  eqtr3i(cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)))), cmpt(s0, c2, cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(s0)))), c0)
  eqtri(c0, cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)))), cmpt(s0, c2, cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(s0)))))
  cbvmptv(s0, hs0, c2, cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(s0))), cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(hs0))))
  2fveq3(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c1, c3)
  eqtri(cmpt(hs0, c2, cdif(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), ciun(hs2, co(c4, cfzo, cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, cv(hs2))))), cmpt(s0, c2, cdif(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), ciun(hs1, co(c4, cfzo, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, cv(hs1))))), cmpt(hs0, c2, cdif(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), ciun(hs1, co(c4, cfzo, cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, cv(hs1))))))
  mpteq2i(hs0, c2, cdif(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), ciun(hs2, co(c4, cfzo, cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, cv(hs2)))), cdif(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), ciun(hs1, co(c4, cfzo, cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, cv(hs1)))))

  fveq2(cv(hs2), cv(hs1), c3)
  cbvmptv(hs0, s0, c2, cdif(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), ciun(hs1, co(c4, cfzo, cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, cv(hs1)))), cdif(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), ciun(hs1, co(c4, cfzo, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, cv(hs1)))))
  difeq12d(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), ciun(hs1, co(c4, cfzo, cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, cv(hs1))), cfv(c3, cv(s0)), ciun(hs1, co(c4, cfzo, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, cv(hs1))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), cv(s0), c3)

blocks.name: meaiuninc2
blocks.content: Measures are continuous from below (bounded case): if ` E ` is a sequence of nondecreasing measurable sets (with bounded measure) then the measure of the union is the limit of the measures. This is Proposition 112C (e) of [Fremlin1] p. 16. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cz))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, cr))

blocks.name: meaiuninc3v
blocks.content: Measures are continuous from below: if ` E ` is a sequence of nondecreasing measurable sets (with bounded measure) then the measure of the union is the limit of the measures. This is the general case of Proposition 112C (e) of [Fremlin1] p. 16 . This theorem generalizes ~ meaiuninc and ~ meaiuninc2 where the sequence is required to be bounded. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 13-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: meaiuninc3
blocks.content: Measures are continuous from below: if ` E ` is a sequence of nondecreasing measurable sets (with bounded measure) then the measure of the union is the limit of the measures. This is the general case of Proposition 112C (e) of [Fremlin1] p. 16 . This theorem generalizes ~ meaiuninc and ~ meaiuninc2 where the sequence is required to be bounded. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 13-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cz))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c3, c2, cdm(c1)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wss(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c2, cfv(c1, cfv(c3, cv(s0)))))

} = {
  syl6breq(c0, clsxlim, cfv(c1, ciun(s0, c2, cfv(c3, cv(s0)))), cfv(c1, ciun(hs0, c2, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)))), w0)

  nfim(s0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wss(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1))))
  nfan(s0, w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))

blocks.name: meaiininclem
blocks.content: Measures are continuous from above: if ` E ` is a nonincreasing sequence of measurable sets, and any of the sets has finite measure, then the measure of the intersection is the limit of the measures. This is Proposition 112C (f) of [Fremlin1] p. 16. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: meaiininc
blocks.content: Measures are continuous from above: if ` E ` is a nonincreasing sequence of measurable sets, and any of the sets has finite measure, then the measure of the intersection is the limit of the measures. This is Proposition 112C (f) of [Fremlin1] p. 16. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)
